etymologies: late 19th century. From ancient Greek πονηρός oppressed, injurious, evil (from πόνος work, labour (from an ablaut variant (o-grade) of the root of πένεσθαι to labour: see -penia) + -ηρος, extended form of -ρος, suffix forming adjectives) + -logy

definitions: A theory or doctrine of evil.
